title: Order relative to authorizing the joint committee on Consumer Protection and Professional Licensure to make an investigation and study of certain current Senate documents relative to consumer protection and professional licensure matters

abstracts.abstract: Senate, October 30, 2025 -- The committee on Consumer Protection and Professional Licensure, to whom was referred the petitions (accompanied by bill, Senate, No. 223) of Peter J. Durant and Donald R. Berthiaume, Jr. relative to homeowners right to perform electrical work; (accompanied by bill, Senate, No. 260) of Mark C. Montigny for legislation to protect the privacy of lottery winners; and (accompanied by bill, Senate, No. 273) of Patrick M. O'Connor for legislation to reduce lottery littering, report the accompanying Order  (Senate, No. 2674).

actions.description: Reported from the committee on Consumer Protection and Professional Licensure
Accompanied by S223, S260 and S273
Order reported favorably by committee and referred to the committee on Rules of the two branches, acting concurrently

related_entities.name: the committee on Rules of the two branches, acting concurrently
committee on Rules of the two branches, acting concurrently

actions.description: Discharged to the committee on Senate Rules
